div.l: The Cokꝭes Tale
A Prentys whilom̄ dwelled in oure Cyte
And of crafte a vyteler was he
Gaylard he was as Goldefynche in the schawe
Broun̄ as a Bery a proper schorte felawe
With lokkꝭes blake y kempte full fetysly
Daunse he kowde full well and Iolyly
That he was clepud perkyn̄ Revelour͗e
He was as full of loue and ꝑparamour͗e
As ys the hyve full of hony swete
Well was þe wenche with hym myght mete
At eủery brydale wold he synge and hoppe
He loued bett̉er the Tauerne than the schop
For whan̄ ther any Rydyng was in chepe
Oute of the schop̄ thider wold he lepe
Tyll that he had all the sight yseyn̄
And daunsed wel he wold not com̄ ageyn̄
And gederd hym a meyne of his sorte
To hoppe and synge and make such a dysporte
And þer they setten steven̄ for to mete
To pleyen̄ at þe dyse in such a strete
For in the toun̄ nas ther no prentys
That fayrer kowde caste a peyre of dyse
Then ꝑperkyn̄ kowde and þ̉er to he was Fre
Of his dyspense in plase of pⁱriuete
That fonde his mayst̉er wel in his chaffar͗e
For ofte tyme he fonde his boxe full bare
For sykerly a prentys a Revelour̉e
That haunteth dyse Ryotte or ꝑparamoᵘur
His mayst̉er schall in his schop̄ abye ·
All thouȝe he haue no parte of þe mynstralsye
For thefte and Ryot ben̄ conuertyble
All gan̄ he pley on Gyterne or rubyble
Reuel and trouth as in low degre
They ben̄ full wroth as all day men̄ may see
This Ioly prentys with his mayste bode
